subject: A Brave New World... Cover
event: Bantam has changed the cover for our forthcoming concordance, THE WORLD OF ICE & FIRE, several times. You've seen a couple of the earlier mockups here and on my website. Now here's the latest and... I am told... final cover.  How do you like it?  WORLD OF ICE & FIRE will be out in the fall.  It is going to be a gorgeous book, a big coffee table volume with lots and lots of stunning artwork, and tons of fake history.  We were supposed to provide 50,000 words of text, but... ah... I got carried away.

props.taglist: bantam spectra, a song of ice and fire

comments.article:
"Got carried away" are the words I didn't know I most wanted to hear, until I heard them.

I will have this book.

Now I just need to figure out how to say "All men must dance" in Valaryan, and my life won't be complete, but some of the itchiness will be relieved.
Sorry buddy.. The word "dance" doesn´t yet exist in the Valyrian vocabulary. :P
awesome

I know exactly what I'll be getting my dad for Christmas. And likely what he'll get me :D
Can't wait for this!
Looks great! Can't wait to add it to my collection. Will have to buy 2 copies (one to read & one to collect).

I would fork over more $ though if you had a special edition. One that is leather bound with thick golden pages and all weathered looking as if it's been in the Citadel for hundreds of years.

But what's in between the covers is what matters. And that'll give me months of good reading and re-reading.
comments.subject: Cover isn't bad...

comments.article:
I agree. A special edition version would be awesome. Nice collector's item, too.

This book cover looks good. It's nicely done.
comments.subject: Re: special edition

comments.article: Gorgeous! I absolutely love the cover and can't wait to read the volume- about to preorder it :) Have to brush up on my Westerosi history!
comments.subject: Love it.

comments.article: Cover looks great! Can't wait to read more fake history.
comments.subject: Excited

comments.article: I'm a fan -- I was also a fan of the Iron Throne cover, but this one works just as well! Can't wait to get my hands on a copy, judging from your sample chapter we should all be in for a treat come fall. I try not to judge a book by its cover anyway :)
comments.subject: Looks Good to Me!

comments.article: Can't wait!  I look forward to seeing how 'carried away' you got.  The more the better!
comments.subject: Badass!

comments.article:
Looking forward to it.

Will it delve into the history of Essos, Sothoryos or Ulthos?

And what histories are being saved for Fire and Blood?
The detailed histories of the reigns of the Targaryen kings.
Very handsome.
So so excited about this can not wait to read this. Looking forward to reading about the history of House Stark and Targaryen. Also, even reading about House Greyjoy's history.
comments.subject: World of Ice and Fire

comments.article: Awesome work! How many pages? Hope it arrives here in Brazil soon! Love
I heard the book will cover some additional parts to "princess and the Queen". Is that true?
comments.subject: World of ice and fire

comments.article: No, not really.
comments.subject: Re: World of ice and fire
Re: World of ice and fire

comments.article: Is that a black three-headed dragon on red? Interesting...
comments.subject: colors

comments.article: A must-have compendium for all ASOIAF fans.  It will certainly adorn my coffee table as soon as it arrives! :-)
Does this gorgeous book happen to talk about the Valyrian Freehold?
comments.subject: Valyrian Freehold

comments.upictitle: the silver lady: spring bluebell woods by fluidic_icons
comments.article: Looks rather good. I look forward to it!

I love it! I think I'm looking forward to this book almost as much as "The Winds of Winter." The (fake) history just by itself is of great interest to me. If it was just that I'd be quite happy. But no, there's going to be a ton of incredible artwork too.

I can't wait! Is it fall yet?!
comments.subject: Love it!

comments.article: Is all the artwork original artwork or will there be images we have seen before elsewhere?
comments.subject: Artwork

comments.article: Most of the artwork will be original... but yes, there are some images you have seen before.  The most conspicuous ones probably being Ted Nasmith's marvelous paintings of the castles of the Westeros, which were originally done for this book, long before we used 'em for the 2011 Ice & Fire calendar.
comments.subject: Re: Artwork

comments.article:
Nice cover!
I love the dragon. I'll buy this book for sure!

But the cover seems to be a "dark" dragon in a kind of redish background. Are you trying to blackfyre us, Ser GRMM?

hahah, just kidding.
comments.subject: Nice!

comments.article:
That looks kinda like the Blackfyre sigil on the there with the whole red circle behind a black metallic dragon. Is that on Purpose or is it supposed to be the Targaryen sigil and the reversed colors are just a fluke?

Can't wait for the book!
comments.subject: Sigil

comments.article: Nice cover, I must have it. Will it cover events from other continents as well?
comments.subject: Nice

comments.article:
Thank you George so much for this world you've created. I haven't been this engrossed in a fictional world since I was a kid. It's a true testament to your creation that there are dozens of websites and forums around the globe that do nothing but talk about the nuances of the characters, languages, places, and events you've created.

This series will endure the test of time and that's testament to the brilliant, and I'm sure arduous, work you've done. Not many people have something they created last forever. Congratulations and once again, thank you. You're now my favorite three initial then last name author of all time.
comments.subject: Thank You!

comments.article:
I love this cover. This book seems dangerous and twisted. Like a dark book full of forbidden knowledge, something that should be locked away in a dark vault somewhere beneath the Citadel.

I wonder, will there be some informations about fools in it? I love these guys. They know so much tricks. How do they do that? Maybe there is some kind of fool's school somewhere in westerosn, like there is the Citadel for the maesters?

Peraphs there will be some infos about the maesters themself too, and the kind of things that they study at the Citadel? I counted 21 archmaesters in the appendix of AFFC, and so far we know that maesters can learn about Healing, Ravens, Economy, Maths, Higher Mysteries, Poisons, Stargazings and a few other things. But I wonder what are the others. Common language literature? Foreigns languages? Secrets languages?
Songs of The Extremly Greats Ancients from the Necronomicon? Obsidian candle Gazing? Really Advanced Philosophy of Hobbes? Yoga?

But peraphs we will have to wait for Sam's chapters in TWOW to know that.
comments.subject: Twisted book
